text: Railway World was an English-based monthly magazine covering rail transport in Great Britain. Founded by GH Lake in 1939 as Railways, in 1940 it was taken over by JW Fowler and renamed Railway World. It was sold to Ian Allan Publishing in 1959.Mr JW Fowler Railway World issue 355 December 1969 page 521Railway World Ian Allan Publishing The final edition was published in February 2003, it was superseded by Railways Illustrated the following month. ==References== Category:Monthly magazines published in the United Kingdom Category:Magazines established in 1939 Category:Magazines disestablished in 2003 Category:Rail transport magazines published in the United Kingdom Category:1939 establishments in England Category:2003 disestablishments in England
title: Railway World
